Description: Rim sherd of Chian Mature Animal Style pottery chalice; white slip; interior: reserved band at rim, glazed streaky black below; large lotus flower in added white outline with added red centres; exterior: at rim, band of short diagonal strokes between dilute lines; below, painted decoration consisting of sphinx to left (part of head, curlicue and wing remaining with red on hair); rosette as filling ornament.
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by Antikenmuseum, Heidelberg. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.
For parallels regarding the interior and exterior decoration, see British Museum 1965,0930.280.
Bibliographic references: CVA Heidelberg I / Corpus Vasorum Antiquorum Heidelberg Universität Band I (p. 13, no. 9, no. 12, pl. 3)
Lemos 1991 / Archaic Pottery of Chios. The Decorated Styles (p. 266, no. 599, pl. 75)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GD.0596) (phase 2)
